speaker: Teacher
text: Good morning class! Today we're working on group science projects about renewable energy.

speaker: Emma Johnson
text: I'm really excited! Can I work with Sarah on the solar energy project?

speaker: Teacher
text: Sure Emma, but I'll need you to include Marcus in your group too.

speaker: Emma Johnson
text: Absolutely! The more ideas we have, the better our project will be. Marcus, do you want to join us?

speaker: Marcus Williams
text: I don't know much about solar energy though...

speaker: Emma Johnson
text: That's totally okay! None of us are experts yet - that's why we're learning. We can all research different parts and teach each other. I think your perspective will actually help us think of things Sarah and I might miss.

speaker: Sarah Chen
text: Yeah! Plus I heard you're really good at building things. Maybe you could help us create a model?

speaker: Marcus Williams
text: Oh, I do like building stuff. Okay, I'm in!

speaker: Emma Johnson
text: Great! Let's start by dividing up the research tasks. Marcus, since you're interested in building, do you want to research how solar panels are physically constructed?

speaker: Teacher
text: I love how you're organizing this Emma. Remember, everyone needs to contribute equally to the presentation.

speaker: Emma Johnson
text: Got it! We'll make sure to check in with each other every day and adjust if someone needs help. Is that okay with everyone?

speaker: Emma Johnson
text: Perfect! Let's exchange phone numbers so we can text if anyone gets stuck on homework.
